meanings.definition: To arrange in a different order.
meanings.sent1: She is reordering her bookshelf to make it look neater.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is reordering the books by genre.
meanings.sent3: The students were reordering their desks for a fun classroom activity.
meanings.sent4: The chef was reordering the ingredients to follow the recipe correctly.
meanings.sent5: The team captain was reordering the players to form a stronger defense.

meanings.definition: The act of changing the order of something.
meanings.sent1: The reordering of the schedule caused confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent2: The reordering of the alphabet made it easier for the children to learn.
meanings.sent3: The reordering of the seating arrangement led to unexpected friendships.
meanings.sent4: The reordering of the menu items improved customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The reordering of the files on the computer saved time during the presentation.
